learning_outcomes.description: Describe and explain Physics concepts, theories, models, systems, and their limitations
Apply understanding of Physics concepts, theories, models, and systems within their limitations
Analyse and interpret evidence presented within physics questions, obtained from experiments, and research questions
Investigate relevant physics phenomena presented in physics questions, associated with experiments, and research questions
Evaluate processes, claims and conclusions presented in physics questions, experiments, and research questions
Communicate understandings, findings, arguments and conclusions associated with physics questions, experiments, and research question

learning_activities.topic:
Fundamentals

Safety in the laboratory, Measurement and Mathematical concepts applicable to Physics, Error analysis and graphical analysis.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Fundamentals Safety in the laboratory, Measurement and Mathematical concepts applicable to Physics, Error analysis and graphical analysis.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 5(21 Oct - 17 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Linear Motion and Forces

Vectors - 1d and 2d vectors; Linear motion; Motion graphs; Newtons laws of motion; Force; Free-body force diagrams; Energy, Work Done and Power


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Linear Motion and Forces Vectors - 1d and 2d vectors; Linear motion; Motion graphs; Newtons laws of motion; Force; Free-body force diagrams; Energy, Work Done and Power

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 6 To Week 7(18 Nov - 01 Dec)
learning_activities.topic:
Heating Processes

Kinetic particle model and heat flow; Temperature and specific heat capacity; Phase changes and latent heat; Energy in systems mechanical work and efficiency.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Heating Processes Kinetic particle model and heat flow; Temperature and specific heat capacity; Phase changes and latent heat; Energy in systems mechanical work and efficiency.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 8 To Week 10(02 Dec - 22 Dec)
learning_activities.topic:
Electrical Circuits

Current, potential difference and energy flow; Resistance; Circuit analysis and design; Experiment A: Electric Circuits (Parnell 7 Lab); Revision


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Electrical Circuits Current, potential difference and energy flow; Resistance; Circuit analysis and design; Experiment A: Electric Circuits (Parnell 7 Lab); Revision

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 11 To Week 15(06 Jan - 09 Feb)
learning_activities.topic:
Gravity and Motion

Projectile motion; Force and momentum; Inclined planes; Circular motion; Gravitational force and fields; Orbits


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Gravity and Motion Projectile motion; Force and momentum; Inclined planes; Circular motion; Gravitational force and fields; Orbits

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 16 To Week 19(10 Feb - 09 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Electromagnetism

Electrostatics and Electric Fields; Magnetic fields; Electromagnetic induction; Experiment B - Magnetic field strength of a solenoid (Parnell 7 Lab)


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Electromagnetism Electrostatics and Electric Fields; Magnetic fields; Electromagnetic induction; Experiment B - Magnetic field strength of a solenoid (Parnell 7 Lab)
